review.reviewText: Ok if u are on a budget. Everything is very old, basically bare bones.

review.title: What you would expect
review.reviewText: The facility's location was fantastic - right in the middle of things. The bed wasn't super and the AC was loud. But it was fine for a pre-cruise stop over.
review.positiveRemarks: Had great balcony views and a historic feel.
review.negativeRemarks: Don't use plastic liners on your pillows, the crunch under the pillow case was disturbing.
review.locationRemarks: Had good meal at Restaurante Raices, which was recommended by the receptionist.

review.title: Nice Hostel, Priced Right in Old San Juan
review.reviewText: Booked this hostel due to the price being right.  Went in prepared to expect the worst and laugh it off, however, was really happy with the overall experience and would do it again.  The only real downfall was the elevator was out of service and the check in is on the 6th floor, our room was on the 5th floor.
review.locationRemarks: Your in the heart of Old San Juan which is a great historical city environment to walk around in.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Easy walk to historic sites and eateries. Comfortable bed, very basic room. The rooms are on the 6th floor and the elevator does not work. The hotel had no water in the morning so could not take a shower.

review.title: Great bang for the buck and location
review.reviewText: Clean hotel and very friendly , helpful staff. Location is prime since it's in il San Juan next to the fort and the balcony view oversees most of the city and into the water. Center of all the restaurants and bars in city, a plus. Very very difficult to find parking although there is a garage nearby but who wants to pay. And rooms were clean and very simple. Shared bathrooms but there were several on each floor luckily I was right next to one so I didn't mind.

review.title: BUGGED
review.reviewText: GOT TO THE HOTEL AROUND 12:30PM TO CHECK-IN, OR AT LEAST STORE LUGGAGE.  THERE WAS NO STAFF ON DUTY. HAD TO WAIT AN HOUR FOR THE FRONT DESK ATTENDANT TO COME BACK FROM LUNCH.  ELEVATOR WAS WORKING AT THIS TIME(6TH) FLOOR.   ROOM WAS OLD, BUT CLEAN.   TOOK A NAP AND MY WIFE WOKE-UP ITCHING.  SAW VERY SMALL ANTS-BUGS, WAS TOLD LATER THAT IT COULD HAVE BEEN SAND FLIES.  I THOUGHT BED BUGS BECAUSE WE KILLED TWO ON THE SHEETS AND THEY LEFT A BLOODY STAIN.  THE NEXT MORNING MY WIFE AD BITES ALL-OVER HER ARMS AND LEGS. WE LET THE DESK ATTENDANT KNOW AT CHECK-OUT, SINCE THERE'S NO ONE ON DUTY OVER NIGHT.   SHE APOLOGIZED   AND OFFERED SOME ALOE LOTION, BUT THEN COULDN'T FIND IT.  ONLY HAD SUN TAN LOTION.  BUT THAT WAS IT...  NO DISCOUNT OFFERS FOR THAT STAY OR FUTURE STAYS, NOTHING.   THEN THE ELEVATOR HAD BROKEN DOWN OVER NIGHT.   WE HAD TO LUG SIX SUITCASES DOWN THE NARROW STAIRWAY( SIX FLOORS!), NO STAFF TO HELP, NO BELL BOYS...  AND TO MAKE MATTERS WORST, PEOPLE COMING IN TO CHECK-IN WERE TRYING TO CARRY THEIR SUITCASES UP THE STAIRS AT THE SAME TIME, AND IT WAS HOT.  NO AIR IN THE STAIRWAY.
review.negativeRemarks: PUT NEW ELEVATOR IN HOTEL, CHECK ON BUG PROBLEM...
review.locationRemarks: GOOD SHOPPING,BARS AND FOOD PLACES.  VERY CLOSE TO CRUISE PORT.

review.title: Got to love San Juan!!!!!!
review.reviewText:
My family of 6 (including 4 teenagers) recently spent 2 nights in San Juan while we waited to pick up our cruise....and we loved it. 
 Luckily our taxi driver from the airport knew where Posada San Francisco was as we would never have found it. It is literally a doorway, with reception on the 6th floor.  We had 2 family rooms, each with 2 double beds, on the 5th and 6th floors.  The layout of the hotel meant that the family room on the 5th floor basically had its own private bathroom which was a bonus.  The rooms were spotless and the common area offered an amazing view of old San Juan and the waterfront. We were treated to beautiful music being played in the square in front of the hotel. We had 2 nights sitting out on the balcony using the hotels wifi and being serenaded by the most talented singers and musicians.  It was magical. 
 The elevator to get to the hotel was "interesting".  It worked most of the time but was definitely temperamental. After being stuck in it twice my gorgeous13 year old used the stairs.  Make sure you don't overload it and you should be fine.
There are heaps of spectacular restaurants nearby that serve traditional Puerto Rican food but they are a bit pricey so be prepared.  
Overall we had a lovely 2 days exploring this exquisite city and soaking in the culture.. 
...got to love San Juan.
review.negativeRemarks: ceiling fans in the rooms would help with the heat...It was very hot and hard to sleep at night
review.locationRemarks: The Fort is next door and there are plenty of places to eat in the old city.  We enjoyed just walking around enjoying the sights.

review.title: Waste of time snd money
review.reviewText:
Felt like this was one step up off the outside curb. 
Morning views were beautiful. But leaving medicine and important items that somehow disappeared when we returned from seeing the beautiful views rrom the terrace.

review.title: Staff great- room- not!
review.reviewText: Rode from taxi to hotel- cost $26.  Crazy driver but we only took about 15 minute to get here. He dropped us at curb and there was no sign to the hotel; only an old building with large iron door(which was locked) we were lucky enough to ener when another patron came in- he let us in and guided us to 6th floor- check in. Was pleased when greeted by desk clerk, she was so very nice. We pd extra $5.  For coming in after 10.pm. She Led us to our room and when she opened the door- I was shocked at the appearance and the smallness of room. It did have a small fridge. The room was about  6x8 and a full size bed. The restrooms were outside the room and shared with others. (In making the reservations I told myself we could "deal" with the $95.00 for 8 hours) We did finally get to sleep and was ready for check out at 11am. One plus for the hotel was AMAZING views of Old San Juan. Will I ever stay here again? No- I will opt for the better hotels.
Hotel was as advertised, however both the room and bathroom could have been cleaned better prior to my arrival. Great location.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Situated in the middle of Old San Juan the hostel provides a great location for a cheap price, and with clean but basic facilities.  We had a basic private room, mattress and pillows are hard but everything was very clean and view from the balconies superb.  The hostel staff was friendly, check-in and check-out easy, and there is a space to store your luggage if you want to explore the area pre or post check-in/out times.
review.locationRemarks: Old San Juan has numerous historic attractions, including 2 forts, great atmosphere, and lots of restaurants and shops.

review.title: A well located option in the old town
review.reviewText: Posada San Francisco is a nice budget option close to most of the attractions in the Old San Juan and also nearby the port (piers 1-4).

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel located at center of Old San Juan but is difficult to find. Room is clean. Shared bathrooms are always available.

review.title: Amazing View!
review.reviewText: This hostel has an amazing view! It is clean and has all the basics covered.

review.title: Great hotel with an excellent location!
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because of the price and vicinity to the cruise ship pier and was a little apprehensive about the idea of sharing a bathroom with other guests. However, once we arrived, this did not bother us at all!  There were three bathrooms on our floor and we never had to wait to get into one of them. This hotel has very simple accommodations but has everything you need. The location was PERFECT! Right in the middle of Old San Juan, overlooks a plaza square with bars, restaurants and shopping all right off the hotel doorstep. The hotel has many terraces that overlook the plaza and Old San Juan with spectacular views of the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps a few more amenities in the room but for the price this hotel had everything you needed.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of cafe's, restaurants and bars nearby. Great for cruisers as you can walk to the cruise pier. The hotel is also right next to Fort San Cristobal

review.title: It was great placement in old San Juan
review.reviewText: It was a nice little hotel and it was a room to stay in. It felt like an authentic experience, and was good for the price we paid.

review.title: Old building with serious fire safety concerns.
review.reviewText: There are a miraid of very dangerous fire safety issues in this old building. The staff was pleasant, the beds and ac were comfortable. Could of had either shelves or some furniture to place some of our belongings on. There was a double bed and a small fridge in our room.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location, beautiful ceiling paintings on the first floor areas.
review.negativeRemarks: A fire anywhere in this old building would likely lead to trapped occupants on the upper floor rooms. Needs fire protection, enclosures and exits.

photos.caption: From the balcony of the Posada.

review.title: My Viejo San Juan
review.reviewText: We arrived early and discovered that the office was on the 6th floor. This was a relief, I thought maybe it was a scam.  We were directed to the 6th floor by local residents. The office staff is very friendly and quickly gave us our room. The room is private with a bed, towels, and a shared bathroom.  We spent a total of five nights and enjoyed the location. It was central and we were able to walk to our ship excursion and also booked an excursion to the rainforest and beaches at the Sheraton.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked being in down town San Juan. We walked a lot and also used the free trolleys.  The Posada provides a furnished kitchen and laundry facilities.
review.negativeRemarks: I would like to have a clean towel daily.  Other than that we were very happy and met many friendly tourists.
review.locationRemarks: You are centrally located and can walk to the ship. The restaurants and souvenir shops are close by.

review.title: Nice place on a really good location
review.reviewText:
Beautiful view over old Juan
Perfect located close by bus stop and for tour pickups

review.title: The worst trip I've done in my own island.
review.reviewText:
I waited more than ten minutes for the girl at the front desk, till she finish to talked with someone by cellular.
No bathrooms in the room, one bathroom in common for all the rooms in the floor.
Smells bad, my wife began with asthma immediately so I had to leave the hotel without being able to complain to someone because after 5 o'clock there's no one at the front desk.
review.positiveRemarks: The only thing I did like is the location.
review.negativeRemarks: Improves the commitment wanting to please the tourists who come to our beautiful island, with a place that look and feel good even if is cheap.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location, near all the history and beautiful places of San Juan.

review.title: A Great Value
review.reviewText: This is a good place for the price, and the location is absolutely perfect! While it does have shared bathrooms and the rooms are small and sparsely furnished, it was perfect for our needs. We got in at 5am and just needed a place to crash and store our stuff until we left on a cruise the next day. They have a luggage room that we kept our stuff in while we were out walking around, shopping, and eating lunch after we checked out. We could have kept our bags there until 5pm even though we checked out that morning, but we picked them up around 2 and took a short taxi ride to the ship. The staff was very friendly and accommodating; I had been a little put off by the harshly-worded website information, but we didn't have any issues checking in so late or leaving our bags with them. We will definitely stay here for a night if we cruise out of San Juan again, but a longer stay for a vacation in San Juan might not be great. They do have beautiful balconies and nice common areas that we didn't really have time to enjoy, but the beds and bathrooms definitely don't make you feel like you're on vacation. The location is amazing for quick access to all that Old San Juan has to offer!
Great location, but really hard to find. The hotel name is not visible anywhere.

review.title: Simple, no frills, inexpensive, clean
review.reviewText: Great place to stay for a budget minded person. Nothing fancy, but has everything you'd expect for the price. Fairly clean, feels safe. The view from the balcony was amazing. I would highly recommend this place if you're on a budget.

review.title: Excellent option in Old San Juan.
review.reviewText: We stayed for 2 nights prior to embarking on a Carnival Cruise.  The location was very convenient for exploring Old San Juan.  The rates are very reasonable.  Wifi is provided for free.  The bed was not comfortable.  We did not have hot water for showering (2 out of 3 showers).  The room and common rooms were clean.  View from the balcony was beautiful.  Check in and out was easy.  They have free baggage storage after check out until boarding time for the cruise.  We never had to wait to use the shared bathrooms.
review.locationRemarks: It's easy to explore the entire island from the location.  From El Morro, to a local farmer's market, to walking to our cruise pier #4 with baggage.

review.title: This is not a hotel it is a Hostel!!!!!!!!
review.reviewText: The room was dirty, no clean towels, bathrooms were always dirty. I would never stay at a place like this. My first experience with your company was HORRIABLE.......
review.negativeRemarks: Your staff should know what they are recommending!!!!!

review.title: Great location in Old San Juan
review.reviewText: My wife and I are adventurers, so love to meet people and experience life. The Posado San Francsico met our expectations and we much appreciated the location. A wonderful view, close to all that we needed, great hosts, and a short walk with luggage to the cruise terminal. We definitely would stay there next trip. It is not an all inclusive, stay in my room, I need to be pampered facility.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, location, location..where else could you have history just out side your door step, with a few steps to food and drink.
review.negativeRemarks: Hours, remember check in is after 3pm, BUT you can leave your luggage locked up after 9am.
review.locationRemarks: Prime location, we walked every where in Old San Juan, to the forts, farmers market, Walgreens, fabulous cafes and bars.

review.title: Very nice experience.
review.reviewText: Stayed for two nights and enjoyed it very much.  Loved being able to do our own cooking.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was very clean, open, airy, with a well stocked kitchen and bathrooms.  The view from the balcony was outstanding, and the hotel charming.
review.negativeRemarks: A few inexpensive conveniences would have improved things greatly; a small shelf and a hook or two in the bathrooms would have been great.
review.locationRemarks: Good location at the entryway to Old San Juan.

review.reviewText: Great place to stay. Staff was very helpful and accommodating. The hotel is a perfect location to explore Old San Juan and the fort. Would definitely stay there again.

When we arrived, the elevator to the 6th floor wasn't working.  Lucky for us, one of New York's finest police was in the lobby and carried our bags up for us.  Thank you so very much!  The elevator worked every time after that.  The hotel was very adequate and is in a great location.  We enjoyed our stay very much and would say here again.

review.title: Bare minimum room
review.reviewText:
room was bleak like a penitentiary cell (except for a refrigerator):  no windows. huge noisy air conditioner. bed. chair. a wooden cross above the bed. closet smelled terribly of bleach. 
We had a hard time reaching them. no answer by phone. no answering machine.

on the bright side: the common rooms (kitchen, salon and balcony) were quite pleasant with a great view! Staff was friendly and let me store my luggage after check out and use the kitchen. 
Altogether i think the room is overpriced for what it offers.
review.negativeRemarks:
fans instead of air conditioner. don't  use bleach. get rid of wooden cross. 
answer the phone!
review.locationRemarks: salsa bar a block down the street.

review.title: Good experience for any backpackers.
review.reviewText: A great central location to walk every sightseeing.

review.title: Well located but really needs basic upgrading
review.reviewText: When we arrived, the elevator was not functioning and we had to walk up 6 floors with our luggage!! It wasn't fixed till the next day. The rooms are bare - just a bed, a chair and a small fridge. No bedside table and lamp which is really practical. Even a hook or two on the wall to hang up a towel to dry would have been appreciated. The bathrooms were clean but basic - hooks to hang your clothes and towels on were non-existent. There is no shampoo or soap, so don't forget to bring your own. Internet access was only in the public areas, not in the rooms. The view from the balconies of the public areas was great and the location was perfect for visiting old San Juan. The price is low so your expectations have to match the price.
review.locationRemarks: Easy walk to all areas of old San Juan, the forts, the shops, the restaurants and the pier.

review.title: Good choice for easy-going budget traveler
review.reviewText: The room itself was spacious and very modest, with a small firm bed, one chair, and the smallest night stand. Hard-working, helpful staff. Staff were constantly cleaning, yet the facility always seemed in need of more cleaning. The air conditioner was extremely loud, the small high window in our room could not open, and there was no curtain to keep the morning light out. The biggest problems were the repairs needed. The elevator to our fifth floor was often broken. The water for showers would slow to just drips at times, and would even stop altogether, and when there was water it would often be cold. The washer and dryer were broken on our first visit, and one toilet didn't flush. I'm very sensitive to mold and chemicals, and I was relieved there were no such problems for my lungs in this modest facility. There is no staff at night, and the first time we tried to use our card to return through the main door we couldn't make it work, until a helpful man who worked next door showed us the unexpected angle the card needed to be inserted--he seemed used to helping out visitors to the hostel this way, but a note there is needed. My husband is tall and kept hitting his head on one low spot above the stairwell.
review.positiveRemarks: For people trying to keep costs minimal who are easy-going about what the accommodation may offer, this is a good choice.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator to our fifth floor was often broken. The water for showers would slow to just drips at times, and would even stop altogether.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location in Old San Juan with two wonderful restaurants with outdoor seating on either side. Balcony with amazing view overlooking plaza.

review.title: Good value, nice views from balconies.
review.reviewText: Unreliable communication; sent them facebook messages and emails, all of which went unanswered, to let them know that we would be arriving very late.  After several tries to call, eventually got through to someone who assured me that they had staff at the desk 24 hours to let us in, and she also assured me that she would note our arrival time to make sure we got in... but once we arrived, they did not answer the doorbell or phone so it looked like we would be locked out.  Luckily, our taxi driver did a google search on his mobile and found another phone number, not listed on their web page, and we were let in after waiting about 20 minutes.  Once we were inside, the lady at the desk was very friendly and helpful.  The rooms were very basic, but clean, the location is great, and there are good views from the balconies.

review.title: Great location for Viejo San Juan
review.reviewText: Rooms simple but nice, wonderful location to get to know Viejo San Juan, and awesome view from the balconies!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Simple, clean rooms, great staff. Located right on the main square. Private room with two queen sized beds (firm). Hall bathroom could use some updating. View from windows directly onto Historic Fort and Old Town San Juan.

review.title: Great, easy, friendly, well located budget friendl
review.reviewText: We got into Old San Juan after midnight and it was great to have an easy to find location with friendly staff. Now its a pretty minimalist place but if you're looking for that its perfect. Our private room was very clean, bed was comfortable enough and the shared bathroom was clean and never seemed to be occupied. The common area was very nice with a patio looking over the square. Its in a great location and we could walk all around Old San Juan. Again if you're looking for luxury this is not your place but if you're up for sometime simple its worth saving the money.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy, clean, great staff, great location. Simple but very cheap accommodation.
review.locationRemarks: All of Old San Juan is easily walkable.
